instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down with hard drive attached.
threads.message:
Another 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that will shut down as soon as Apple logo appears when internal or external HDD is attached.

This is on battery only and internal HDD unplugged.

[URL]https://photos.app.goo.gl/sdYpveMtFoRYMOqV2[/URL]

When on charger only and internal HDD unplugged it wont even make it to chime.

This is charger only

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/Fn91yGpLOcfU2JoF3[/url]

PPBUS is 12.58V

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down with hard drive attached.
threads.message: Replace RAM module and try again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down with hard drive attached.
threads.message: Hey man thanks for the response.  Switched RAM on both slots... Same outcome. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down with hard drive attached.
threads.message: apply some heat to GPU to test...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down with hard drive attached.
threads.message: I more suspect the CPU Vcore FETs. If no change after heating the GPU change the FETs in the CPU Vcore supply together with <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.
